III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/7/25, two youth were physically fighting, and staff broke up
the fight. One youth ran back towards the other youth and a staff
member pushed the youth to the ground to keep the youth
separated.
Investigation Interviews:
On 06/17/2025 an in-person interview was completed with
Complainant. No additional concerns were reported.
On 06/11/2025 an onsite visit was made to Christ Child House.
An interview was completed with Chief Administrator (CA). She
was advised of the initiation of a new special investigation. CA
advised that she had viewed the video footage and implemented a
safety plan for continued employment of Staff 1 during the
investigation. She further confirmed seeing Staff 1 push Youth A.
On 06/11/2025 an interview was completed with Director of
Residential (DR) at Christ Child House. She confirmed that she
had viewed the video footage and Youth A was pushed down. A
copy of the video footage was provided. A request was made for
disciplinary history for Staff 1, incident report of the event, and
copies of agency policies. She denied having any concerns with
Staff 1.
On 06/11/2025 an interview was completed with Youth A at Christ
Child House. Youth A recalled being “in to” it with Youth B at the
agency. He reported Youth B kept bothering him and this resulted
in them fighting each other. He stated staff was trying to stop
them from fighting and Staff 1 pushed him down. He stated that
this occurred in the front of the building. Youth A denied he was
injured and denied he has been pushed by other staff.
On 06/17/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Supervisor 1
at Christ Child House. He reported that he walked outside and
Youth A was on the ground. Youth A was cursing and saying that
he no longer wanted to be at the facility. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
also present. Supervisor 1 denied seeing what actually occurred
but witnessed Youth A getting up and going into the building with
Staff 2. Supervisor 1 denied seeing any staff push/hit youth at the
facility.
On 06/17/2025 an in-person interview was held with Youth B at
Christ Child House. He confirmed that he and Youth A were
2

fighting, and staff broke it up. He denied seeing Youth A get
pushed to the ground but reported seeing him on the ground. He
denied that staff at Christ Child House is physically aggressive
with him and reported feeling safe at the agency.
On 06/17/2025 an in-person interview was held with Staff 1 at
Christ Child House. He admitted that he pushed Youth A and as a
result, Youth A ended up on the ground. Staff 1 reported that he
did not intend to push Youth A. He stated Youth A was not injured
and he quickly helped him up. He stated in his attempt to
separate Youth A and Youth B, he turned around quickly,
extended his arms and it resulted in Youth A going to the ground.
He denied having any disciplinary action in his file relative to
inappropriate physical engagement with youth at the agency. He
denied he engages in hitting or pushing of youth at the agency.
On 6/26/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 2.
She reported when she came outside Youth A was already on the
ground. She denied witnessing Staff 1 pushing the youth. She
assisted Youth A and denied that he was injured. Staff 2 denied
knowledge of Staff 1 or other staff being physically aggressive
with youth at the agency.
Documents Reviewed:
Christ Child House Discipline & Behavior Management Policy –
Prohibited Procedures: To ensure that residents rights are
protected, and that service is provided in a manner consistent with
best practice standards outlined below, behavior support
guidelines established by Christ Child House specifically prohibit
the use of restrictive or otherwise unacceptable actions by staff
members included, but not limited to the following criteria
examples:
-Corporal punishment of residence by staff
-Fear eliciting/aversive or any other restrictive/intrusive
consequences
-Physical abuse or verbal abuse of residents by staff
HR Discipline File for Staff 1 – July 2023, Verbal Warning for use
of cell phone at work. August 2023, Written Warning for use of
cell phone at work. February 2024, Verbal Warning for leaving
agency vehicle unlocked. September 2024, Three-day
suspension for use of cell phone at work.
Christ Child House Incident Report – Dated 6/07/2025. Report
indicated the incident occurred at approximately 1:20 pm. Youth
A and Youth B were outside playing and a verbal conflict led to a
3

physical altercation. Staff 1 separated them, and the youth went
into the facility. Youth A exited the front door and Youth B came
from around the back area. They attempted to continue with the
physical confrontation. Staff 1 indicated he attempted to separate
them.
Video Review:
Video footage is dated 07/06/2025. Footage begins at 1:28pm
and ends at 1:30pm. Staff 1 is seen walking up to agency door
with Youth B in front of him. Staff 1 reaches for the door to let
Youth B in and Youth A is seen walking up behind them both.
Staff 1 quickly turns around and extends his arms and pushes
Youth A back. Youth A falls to the ground. Staff 2 and Supervisor
1 are then seen walking up and begin to assist Youth A from the
ground.
Agency Tour:
On 06/11/2025 a tour of the agency was completed, specifically
the outside area where the incident occurred. There were no
areas of concern noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth
were interviewed, and video footage was reviewed, which
documented evidence of staff pushing youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001696 dated 10/29/24; CAP Approved 10/31/2024
2025SIC0000705 dated 7/8/25; CAP pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A Corrective Action Plan is required.
